page.title: 19NATURE NOTE FROM NEWTON.
page.content: 05.00hrs.May 18.Morning chorus with at least 15 species singing.9 red deer coming out of Newton Wood put up a heron,snipe,mallard and moorhens at the stream.As they move into the young corn a hare starts up in front of them.A jay scolds in the wood and a fox slinks along the wood margin. Rabbits are grazing among the sheep unaware of a stoat creeping up on them from the shelter of the hedge.On the game-keeper's pole are the bodies of stoats,weasels,hedgehogs,grey squirrels,magpies and crows.All these are considered enemies of the breeding pheasants.Skylarks are rising singing and a green woodpecker yaffles.Some smallbirds mob a kestrel.Very few swallows or house martins have been seen this year.
